image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: Police say they have conducted a "significant" aerial search of a property in South Australia's mid-north, where a four-year-old boy went missing 10 days ago.

title.children: 'Significant' aerial search for four-year-old Gus conducted over the weekend

image.altText: A building with grey, green and brown colouring and the words 'Edge Early Learning'

props.synopsis: The Education Standards Board has closed Edge Early Learning Centre at Plympton for 90 days following an investigation into reports of "inadequate supervision" of children.

title.children: SA childcare centre 'unsuitable to open' amid supervision concerns

image.altText: A male police officer looking into the distance.

props.synopsis: South Australia’s corruption watchdog has cleared Police Commissioner Grant Stevens of a discipline breach for accidentally discharging his firearm during a house raid in the early 1990s.

title.children: SA Police Commissioner cleared over 1990s firearm incident

image.altText: A bunch of healthy looking tomatoes on a vine.

props.synopsis: More than a year since South Australia's $230 million tomato and capsicum sector was plunged into turmoil by the first discovery of the tomato brown rugose fruit virus in Australia, the state has been declared free of the exotic disease.

title.children: Relief for fruit producers as SA declared free from brown rugose virus

image.altText: A smaller Kangaroo stands in front of a larger kangaroo in high grass.

props.synopsis: Farmers are calling for a cull of kangaroos, which they say are being forced onto farmland by drought and dry conditions and consuming what little feed and water they have.

title.children: Kangaroos add pressure on drought-hit farmers by eating scarce feed

image.altText: A vast waterway from above

props.synopsis: The floodwaters which have created an expansive inland oasis on the usually arid salt beds of Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre have reached a peak, and are beginning to evaporate, a local pilot says.

title.children: Floodwaters 'transform whole desert' as Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre reaches peak

image.altText: An empty potato shelf at Woolworths in South Australia.

props.synopsis: South Australia produces 80 per cent of Australia's fresh potatoes, but extreme weather and drought across the state are causing a major shortage.

title.children: Customers face empty shelves as farmers battle potato shortage

image.altText: Two teenage Indigenous boys fishing in the Darling River at Wilcannia, with a man in a blue shirt watching on.

props.synopsis: After decades of lobbying and design controversy, the New South Wales government says it needs another $30–40 million to proceed with the Wilcannia Weir upgrade.

title.children: Outback water project unlikely due to $30m shortfall, minister says

image.altText: Charlie Kirk is stood with a microphone in one hand and a red cap in the other.

props.synopsis: The Australian affiliate of late right-wing activist Charlie Kirk's Turning Point USA is moving into South Australia ahead of next year's state election, but some politicians say the group is "out of step with mainstream values".

title.children: Turning Point Australia moves into SA, ahead of state election

image.altText: A close up image of an SA Police car.

props.synopsis: A Port Pirie woman has been bailed after police downgraded a murder charge laid over the death of a man to aggravated assault.

title.children: Woman's murder charge downgraded over Port Pirie death

image.altText: A red sign on a bus shelter reading Buy the Best, Buy SA Seafood

props.synopsis: While industry and government tell consumers South Australian seafood is safe, consumer demand is still down amid the algal bloom, with businesses concerned they may not survive.

title.children: Seafood 'good as it's ever been' as sellers fear algal bloom message not getting through

image.altText: Masooma smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Masooma came to Adelaide as a refugee from Afghanistan in 2016, and has become the carer of a young girl from a similar cultural background. Experts say it is important carers reflected the diversity of children in care.

title.children: For Afghan refugee Masooma, fostering a child has given her a sense of freedom

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: The 17-year-old was arrested when police found a large number of videos and messages on his phone and laptop depicting violent extremist acts, many of which were highly disturbing.

title.children: Teen found with violent extremist material driven by 'teenage bravado'

image.altText: Two women hugging each other, with one crying on the other’s shoulder.

props.synopsis: Rescue teams worked around the clock through narrow gaps in the rubble of Sidoarjo's Al Khoziny Islamic Boarding School while risking further collapse to reach anyone still alive.

title.children: Inside the dramatic rescue of Indonesian teens buried alive under their school

image.altText: Russian fighter

props.synopsis: The Australian man is accused of breaching Russia's criminal code by participating as a mercenary in an armed conflict.

title.children: Australian sentenced to jail by Russian court for fighting in Ukraine

image.altText: A big industrial building

props.synopsis: Aurora Energy is seeking a $7 million bank guarantee to cover energy costs for the Boyer Mill in southern Tasmania, but the paper mill's owner says the request is "obscene".

title.children: Owner says 'obscene' demand from energy retailer threatens Australia's last paper mill

image.altText: A man in a white shirt and a serious expression looks into the camera.

props.synopsis: A fractured but defiant Israel is struggling to assert itself at home and abroad, on the anniversary of a Hamas attack that triggered the current war in Gaza.

title.children: After two years of war, some Israelis feel a 'reckoning' is coming

image.altText: Ibrahim Helmy sits in chair in front of microphone

props.synopsis: Ibrahim Helmy, who vanished before an inquiry into transport kickbacks, watched the first day of the Independent Commission Against Corruption public hearings via live stream.

title.children: ICAC witness found in cupboard allegedly received $11.5m in payments

image.altText: A sign in a Brisbane park warning of the bushfire risk.

props.synopsis: Parts of the state are still reeling from last season's flooding, storms and rainfall, with the majority of council areas disaster-declared already.

title.children: Country's most disaster-prone state urged to prepare as severe weather looms

image.altText: An adult whale and a whale calf breaching.

props.synopsis: Once hunted almost to extinction, the population of humpback whales currently migrating down Australia's east coast has bounced back and is now greater than before whaling.

title.children: These whales were hunted to 150 individuals. Now there's 50,000 of them

image.altText: ASX

props.synopsis: Australia's share market lost ground after financials, energy and mining stocks were sold off, while the gold price hit another record high. Catch up on the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Gold hits record high, local market loses ground — as it happened

image.altText: Lawrence Wong, a Singaporean man smiles while wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: Singapore wants to expand its military ties with Australia, including through a greater Australian troop presence in the island state as part of an upgraded trade and defence relationship, according to Prime Minister Lawrence Wong.

title.children: Singapore PM warns of 'huge consequences' in ending current world order

image.altText: What looks like an authentic Victorian drivers licence with the name Stuart Parker and a Ramsay Street address.

props.synopsis: Neighbours fans rush to Melbourne op shops after 40 years of props, furniture and Ramsay Street relics were donated to charities.

title.children: Erinsborough High bags, Dr Karl's briefcase among tv props sent to op shop

image.altText: Sebastien Lecornu and Emmanual Macron in navy suits turned towards each other, standing besides the French and EU flag.

props.synopsis: The sudden resignation of France's prime minister — the country's fifth in two years — has put President Emmanuel Macron in a bind.

title.children: Why has France gone through five prime ministers in two years?

image.altText: Two men and a woman stand together in front of a waterfall, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Jacinta McEwan calls for the Australian government to help her son amid reports he has been physically abused after being arrested on a flotilla trying to break Israel's naval blockade of Gaza.

title.children: Mother of Australian from Gaza flotilla pleads: 'Stand up for my son'

image.altText: A young white man with short brown hair and a blue shirt standing in a Melbourne laneway

props.synopsis: An industry survey finds GPs are managing conditions typically handled by specialists due to high costs and only 12 per cent can afford to bulk-bill all patients.

title.children: GP says fees will go up at his clinic when bulk-billing incentives come in

image.altText: Two woman stand in a burnt building with masks on

props.synopsis: Amid more extreme weather events, parametric insurance — described as a bet on the weather —is on the rise. It is now being touted as a possible solution for Australians, who have some of the highest insurance losses in the world.

title.children: Betting on the weather emerges as a solution as insurance costs skyrocket

image.altText: Nick Daicos of the Magpies celebrates a goal, yelling and punching his fist in the air

props.synopsis: The reported attempts to lure Nick Daicos away from Collingwood have headlined the second day of the AFL trade period. Look back at how all the day's trade news unfolded in our blog.

title.children: Rivals reportedly launch bid to lure Nick Daicos from Collingwood

image.altText: A firefighter carries a hiker out on his back in the dark, with a group of people using head torches.

props.synopsis: Villagers have joined rescue crews in attempting to save those who have become stuck in heavy snow on Mount Everest in Tibet.

title.children: Hundreds of hikers still missing after Mount Everest blizzard

image.altText: A woman with brown hair wearing a pink blouse sitting on a couch in a TV studio

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old woman who claims to be Madeleine McCann is on trial charged with stalking the missing child's parents over the past three years.

title.children: Woman claiming to be Madeleine McCann faces court

image.altText: Two US soldiers in fatigues, face covered, sunglasses, crouch on the road, holding a person down, smoke visible in background.

props.synopsis: Illinois is suing to block Donald Trump’s troop deployment to Chicago in what will be the president's fourth legal challenge over federal use of National Guard in cities.

title.children: Illinois sues to stop National Guard in Chicago after court victory

image.altText: An aerial shot of a construction site near the ocean's edge, cranes can be seen below.

props.synopsis: It’s taken 10 years, blown out by hundreds of millions of dollars, and is still nowhere near becoming operational. Now there are calls for the Darwin ship lift project to be scrapped.

title.children: Ship lift project dubbed 'one of the biggest blowouts' in Australia

image.altText: Two pedestrians walking northbound across a three-lane road bridge with a pedestrian path over a lake.

props.synopsis: Loneliness is rising fastest among Canberrans in their 30s and 40s, with new research showing this cohort is now more likely than younger people to report feeling lonely in the ACT.

title.children: Midlife loneliness on the rise in Canberra as financial pressures bite

image.altText: An image of Christmas lunch with ham, turkey and plenty of sides.

props.synopsis: Australians estimate Christmas costs them about $800 a year, on average, but planning ahead can reduce the financial burden.

title.children: How some simple planning can make Christmas easier financially

image.altText: The supermoon as it rises over Mt Coot-tha in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Our skies will be graced by up to four consecutive supermoons over the next months. Here's why they happen, and how we can end up with multiple supermoons in a row.

title.children: A trifecta of supermoons starts with tonight's harvest moon
